name: rateable
content:
rateable adjective
(FINANCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
finance & economics
  specialized A rateable part of something, such as a payment, is an amount that is calculated based on how much someone is owed or should pay, or how much is owed or should be paid for a particular period of time: The Corporation would only pay its rateable proportion of the claim. The policyholder would be responsible for a rateable proportion of the loss. Related word
rateably
finance & economics
  UK, specialized If a property is rateable, it is able to be taxed: rateable value Companies pay business rates at about 44 percent of the rateable value of a commercial property. The table shows the percentage of city households in each rateable banding.
More examplesFewer examplesThe bankers could not continue to allow a rateable interest on money deposited in their banks. At present, rates are calculated from the rateable value of business premises.
